results.title: South America: Indians of the Andes
results.creator_credit: Art Evans Productions and Arthur G. Evans
results.brief_description: Portrays the primitive way of life of an Inca boy and his family in an isolated Peruvian village in the Andes mountains.

results.title: South America today
results.creator_credit: International Film Foundation and Julien Bryan
results.brief_description: An introduction to the wide variety of people and topography to be found in South America. Depicts the Trans-Amazon highway across Brazil, a new steel mill on the Orinoco River, a university in Quito, a peaceful political rally in Santiago, the oldest airline in the Western Hemisphere, a strife-filled street demonstration, old paintings and modern graphics. Features three traditional institutions: the hacienda, the church and the military.

results.title: South America the series. -Volume 5
results.creator_credit: BFA Educational Media and Wayne Mitchell
results.brief_description: Part five of a series of five on South America, this part visits regions west of the famous Andes. The area is defined as including countries on the narrow strip of land between the Andes Mountains and the Pacific Ocean. It includes Equador, Bolivia, Chile and Peru, all of which are rich is their history of early Amerindian civilization.

results.title: South America the series. -Volume 4
results.creator_credit: Phoenix Films, BFA Films and Video and Wayne Mitchell
results.brief_description: Part four of the five part series on South America travels towards the east of the Andes, exploring the countries of Argentina, Paraquay and Uruguay. The countries share a similar Spanish heritage, but as this video suggests, the similarities end there and each country is unique in its peoples and landscape.

results.title: South America the series. -Volume 3
results.creator_credit: Phoenix Films, BFA Films and Video and Wayne Mitchell
results.brief_description: Part three of a series of five on South America covers the country of Brazil. Most people think of coffee when they hear the word Brazil, but South America’s largest nation is also becoming one of the leading industrially developed countries on the continent. Volume three also covers the importance and influence of Portuguese heritage over the country.

results.title: South America the series. -Volume 2
results.creator_credit: Phoenix Films, BFA Films and Video and Wayne Mitchell
results.brief_description: Part two of a series of five on South America travels to the Caribbean Coast visiting five countries from the northern region; Venezuela, Colombia, Guyana, Surinam and French Guiana. These countries possess a diversity in people and landscape but share the same warm tropical equator weather.

results.title: South America the series. -Volume 1
results.brief_description: Part one of 5 programs on South America introduces us to this mixture of people and shows how they are affecting, and being affected by, their heritage, resources, agriculture, industry and urban vs. rural life. The program pays particular attention to the ethnic mix of the continent and the consequent diversity in cultural and agricultural practices.

results.title: South Africa: the white laager
results.creator_credit: Sveriges radio aktiebolag, WGBH (Boston), United Nations Television, Villon Films, Barry Callaghan and Peter F. Davis
results.brief_description: A documentary which explores the history of the Afrikaaners and Afrikaaner nationalism, and the development of apartheid and its relevance to South Africa’s political situation today. Includes interviews with whites in various professions and with differing points of view on apartheid.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sveriges radio aktiebolag, WGBH (Boston), United Nations Television, Villon Films, Barry Callaghan and Peter F. Davis

results.title: South Africa belongs to us
results.creator_credit: Gerhard Schmidt Produktion, WDR and Chris Austin
results.brief_description: A film about black women in South Africa filmed secretly with the help of two black women journalists. Through interviews with five typical women, and comments from four women activists, including Winnie Mandela, the film clearly shows the devastating impact of apartheid on black women and their families. Narration by Peggy Phango.

results.title: Sous les Toits de Paris = Under the Roofs of Paris
results.brief_description:
A street singer falls for a pretty Romanian girl whom he protects from her lecherous lover, but he is accused of theft. ‘Sous les toits de Paris’ was one of the first French talkies and a remarkable experiment in sound, both technically and in its discourse on the possibilities of the new medium. Clair chose to use sound only when needed, preferring to tell the story through his visuals as much as through his dialogue. The result is a striking film, boasting beautiful photography and sets, as well as a moving story. The art direction by Lazare Meerson fixed an iconography of Paris - a sweet version of the darker ‘Poetic Realism’, full of street singers, irate concierges and neighbours, and pretty ‘midinettes’. This iconography is often re-used in the form of a nostalgic homage in recent efforts such as ‘Delicatessen’. Reference: Ginette Vincendeau. The Companion to French cinema. London: BFI publishing, 1996.

Credits: Producer, Frank Clifford ; director, Rene Clair ; writer, Rene Clair ; photography, Georges Perinal ; music, A. Bernard ; art direction, Lazare Meerson.
Cast: Polla Illery, Albert Prejean, Gaston Modot, Jane Pierson, Edmond T. Greville, Raymond Aimos.
